description: From Middle English ennoblen, from Old French ennoblir. Equivalent to en- +â€Ž noble.

verbs.description: ennoble (third-person singular simple present ennobles, present participle ennobling, simple past and past participle ennobled)

entries.meaning: To bestow with nobility, honour or grace.
To perform on a fabric the industrial processes of dry-cleaning, printing and embossing, and sizing and finishing.
